elements.title: Auditor's Responsibility and Opinion on the Remuneration Report

data.value: Our objectives are to obtain reasonable assurance about whether the financial report as a whole is free from material misstatement.
Misstatements can arise from fraud or error and are considered material if they could reasonably be expected to influence economic decisions.
The Remuneration Report of Elixir Energy Limited, for the year ended 30 June 2022, complies with section 300A of the Corporations Act 2001.

elements.title: Earnings Per Share and Employee Benefits

data.value: Calculated by dividing the profit or loss attributable to equity holders, excluding servicing costs of equity other than ordinary shares, by the weighted average number of shares.
Adjusts basic earnings per share to consider the effect of financing costs on dilutive potential ordinary shares.
Functional currency of each entity is based on primary economic environment. Consolidated presented in Australian dollars.
Provision for liabilities from employee services, measured at expected settlement amounts. Liabilities payable after one year measured at present value of future cash flows.

elements.title: Major Drilling at Nomgon IX 2D Seismic
Recoverability of Exploration and Evaluation Assets

data.value: Recoverability of exploration and evaluation assets
Obtaining a schedule of the area of interest held by the Group and assessing whether the rights to tenure of this area of interest remained current at balance date;

Considering the status of the ongoing exploration programmes in the area of interest by holding discussions with management, and reviewing the Group’s exploration budgets, ASX announcements and directors’ minutes;
Judgement is applied in determining the treatment of exploration expenditure in accordance with Australian Accounting Standard AASB 6 Exploration for and Evaluation of Mineral Resources.
Considering whether the area of interest had reached a stage where a reasonable assessment of economically recoverable reserves existed;
Considering whether any facts or circumstances existed to suggest impairment testing was required;
Directors are responsible for the other information in the Group’s annual report for the year ended 22 June 2022.

The directors of the Company are responsible for the preparation of the financial report that gives a true and fair view in accordance with Australian Accounting Standards and the Corporations Act 2001.
In preparing the financial report, the directors are responsible for assessing the ability of the group to continue as a going concern.

elements.title: Notes to the Consolidated Financial Statements continued

data.value: Financial performance of controlled entities is included only for the period they were controlled.
Assets and liabilities recorded based on relative fair values; no goodwill arises.
Interest revenue recognised as it accrues using the effective interest method.
Consists of current and deferred tax expense.
Measured at expected amounts to be paid or recovered from taxation authorities.
Calculated at expected future tax rates.
Recognised only to the extent it is probable that future taxable profit will be available.
The Group does not consolidate any Australian entities for tax purposes.

elements.title: Notes to the Consolidated Financial Statements

data.value: Expenditure on exploration for and evaluation of petroleum resources is recognised as an asset when incurred, contingent on current rights to tenure.
The carrying value of exploration and evaluation assets is assessed for impairment whenever circumstances suggest the carrying amount may exceed its recoverable amount.
Financial assets and liabilities are recognised when the entity becomes a party to the contractual provisions of the instrument.
Financial assets can be classified as measured at amortised cost, fair value through profit or loss, or fair value through other comprehensive income.
Amortised cost is calculated as the amount at initial recognition, less principal repayments and any reduction for impairment.

elements.title: Notes to the Consolidated Financial Statements continued

data.key: Site Restoration and Environmental Rehabilitation Provision
data.value: Provisions are recognised when the Group has a present obligation as a result of a past event, the future sacrifice of economic benefits is probable and the amount of the obligation can be reliably estimated.

A lease liability and a right of use asset is recognised in the statement of financial position for all leases conveying a right to control the use of an underlying asset with the exception of leases with a period of 12 months or less and for low value leases.

The Directors have prepared the financial report on the going concern basis, which contemplates the continuity of normal business activity and the realisation of assets and settlement of liabilities in the normal course of business.

In certain cases, including when required by Australian Accounting Standards, comparative figures are adjusted to conform to the changes in recognition or presentation made in the current financial year.
No dividends were paid or declared during the current financial year. No franking credits are currently available, or are likely to become available in the next 12 months.

elements.title: Consolidated Statement of Changes in Equity

data.key: Issue of shares to acquire Solar Ilch LLC

data.value: There are no substantial shareholders of Elixir Energy Limited.
6,330,000 Unlisted Options on issue with a weighted average exercise price of 16.32 cents each expiring in 2023 - 2025.
26,200,000 Performance Rights on issue, each convertible into one ordinary share if the relevant performance conditions are met.
6,901,312 fully paid ordinary shares held in voluntary escrow for 9 months and 6,901,310 fully paid ordinary shares held in voluntary escrow for 18 months.
There is no on-market buyback at the date of this report.
Projects include Mongolian exploration: Nomgon IX CSG PSC, Mongolian other: Clean Energy, Australian exploration: ATP 2044.
The Company is listed on the Australian Securities Exchange under the stock symbol EXR.
During the 2022 financial year, the world started to emerge from the multiple constraints imposed by COVID-19.
Elixir Energy Limited was designated as 'Best Investor of 2021' by Mongolia’s Ministry of Mining and Heavy Industry.
Announced acquisition of a licence in Queensland – ATP 2044.
Executed MOU with SB Energy Corp to progress the Gobi H2 project.
Focus on Mongolia’s first long-term gas pilot production project.
Targeted multiple sub-basins across the Nomgon PSC.

elements.title: Independent Auditor's Report for Elixir Energy Limited

data.value: True and fair view of the financial position and performance

elements.title: Notes to the Consolidated Financial Statements

data.value: Elixir Energy Limited (‘Company’) is a for-profit Australian incorporated publicly listed company.

The consolidated financial statements comprise the Company and its controlled entities (‘Group’) and is a general-purpose report that has been prepared in accordance with Australian Accounting Standards and International Financial Reporting Standards.
The pandemic has not impacted the Group’s operations in any significant way to date, and it is not expected to.
There are no issued but not yet effective accounting standards that are expected to significantly impact the Group in future financial years.
Estimates and judgments are based on historical knowledge, best available current information and expectations of future events that may have a financial impact.
Review of capitalised exploration and evaluation expenditure impairment indicators – Note 7 and Estimation of fair value of share-based payments – Note 11.
The Board and management will continue to monitor the impact of the pandemic on the Group’s operations.
